content: अपहृ {c1c} <ab>P.</ab> {@--1@} ({%a%}) To take off, bear or snatch away, carry off; पश्चात्पुत्रैरपहृतभरः <ls>V. 3. 1</ls> relieved of the burden; तंत्रादचिरापहृतः पटः brought <ls>P. V. 2. 70</ls> <ls>Sk.</ls> ({%b%}) To avert, turn away; वदनमपहरंतीं (गौरीं) <ls>Ku. 7. 95</ls> averting or turning away her face. ({%c%}) To rob, plunder, steal. {@--2@} To sever, separate, cut off; <ls>R. 15. 52.</ls> {@--3@} To overpower, overcome, subdue; attract, ravish, captivate; affect, influence (in a good or bad sense); अपह्रिये खलु परिश्रमजनितया निद्रया <ls>U. 1</ls> overpowered; उत्सवापहृतचेतोभिः <ls>Ratn. 1</ls>; यथा नापह्रियसे सुखेन <ls>K. 109</ls> seduced, led away, <ls n="K.">277</ls>; न… प्रियतमा यतमानमपाहरत् <ls>R. 9. 7</ls> did not subdue <ab>i. e.</ab> did not divert his mind. {@--4@} To remove, take away, destroy, annihilate, deprive (one) of; कीर्तिं° <ls>R. 11. 74</ls>; प्रिया मे दत्ता वाक् पुनर्मेऽपहृता <ls>Dk. 52.</ls> {@--5@} To take back, resume; देयं प्रतिश्रुतं चैव दत्त्वा नापहरेत्पुनः <ls>Y. 2. 176.</ls> {@--6@} To subtract, deduct. {%--<ab>Caus.</ab>%} To cause (others) to take away; <ls>Ki. 1. 31.</ls>
